title: nwfscSurvey
text: nwfscSurvey package written scientists Northwest Fisheries Science Center (NWFSC) explore process survey composition data use groundfish stockassessments. package can used NWFSC West Coast Groundfish Bottom Trawl (WCGBT) survey, NWFSC slope survey, Alaska Fisheries Science Center (AFSC) slope survey, AFSC Triennial survey. package includes functions query NWFSC data warehouse, visualize, process data use groundfish assessments.

title: nwfscSurvey
text: nwfscSurvey can used : Pull survey catch, haul, biological data NWFSC data warehouse. Calculate design based indices based upon pre-specified stratification. Create length- age-composition data expanded design-based indices formated use Stock Synthesis. Create unexpanded conditional age--length composition data use Stock Synthesis. Create plots visualize data: design-based index plots, bubble plots length age data, observeed sex ratio, distributions across depth latitude.

title: nwfscSurvey
text: list functions packages can viewed :
code: ls("package:nwfscSurvey")

title: nwfscSurvey
text: Pull catch biological data:
code: catch = pull_catch(   common_name = "Pacific ocean perch",    survey = "NWFSC.Combo")  bio = pull_bio(   common_name = "Pacific ocean perch",    survey = "NWFSC.Combo")

title: nwfscSurvey
text: range functions create visualizations data examining catch rates latitude depth, lengths ages latitude depth, presence/absence tows, observed sex ratios.
code: plot_cpue(   catch = catch)  plot_bio_patterns(   bio = bio,    col_name = "Length_cm")  wh_plot_proportion(   data_catch = catch,   data_bio = bio )

title: nwfscSurvey
text: Depth latitude strata required calculate design-based index abundance well length age compositions. strata specific range species question observed. Note WCGBT Survey sampling design changes sampling intensity 183 549 meters north south 34.5 degrees latitude, generally included strata breaks range spans values. Pacific ocean perch rarely observed south 34.5 degrees deeper 540 m, ’s need include strata observations (survey extends southward 32 degrees deep 1280 m):
code: strata <- CreateStrataDF.fn(   names = c("shallow_s", "deep_s", "shallow_n", "deep_n"),    depths.shallow = c(  55,  183,  55, 183),   depths.deep    = c( 183,  400, 183, 400),   lats.south     = c(34.5, 34.5,  42,  42),   lats.north     = c(  42,   42,  49,  49) )

title: nwfscSurvey
text: Calculate design based index abundance: get_design_based() returns list elements $biomass_by_strata $biomass, second element design based index abundance aggregated across strata. dir function input specified, function writes csv file inside dir input location “forSS3” folder. Plot coastwide design based index abundance uncertainty intervals: Plot design based index abundance strata without uncertainty intervals:
code: biomass = get_design_based(   data = catch,     strata = strata) plot_index(   data = biomass,   plot = 1) plot_index(   data = biomass,   plot = 2)

title: nwfscSurvey
text: get_expanded_comps() calculates formats length-composition data Stock Synthesis: call calculate length frequencies use Stock Synthesis. function returns list sexed unsexed length composition data formatted Stock Synthesis. dir function input specified, write dataframes separate csv files inside dir input location “forSS3” folder. example input sample size calculated based Stewart Hamel approach (e.g., unique samples calculated function species type tows). plot length frequency data: dir function input specified, “plot” folder created directory location png plot saved. also function create raw unexpanded composition data works either length age data. function returns list sexed unsexed length composition data formatted Stock Synthesis. input sample size set equal number samples data frame.
code: length_comps <- get_expanded_comps(     bio_data = bio,     catch_data = catch,     comp_bins = seq(10, 40, 2),     strata = strata,     comp_column_name = "length_cm",     output = "full_expansion_ss3_format",     two_sex_comps = TRUE,     input_n_method = "stewart_hamel") plot_comps(   data = length_comps) raw_length_comps <- get_raw_comps(     data = bio,     comp_bins = seq(10, 40, 2),     comp_column_name = "length_cm",     two_sex_comps = TRUE)

title: nwfscSurvey
text: call calculate marginal age-composition data age data format Stock Synthesis. function returns list sexed unsexed age composition data formatted Stock Synthesis. dir function input specified, write dataframes separate csv files well. example input sample size calculated based Stewart Hamel approach (e.g., unique samples calculated function species type tows). plot age frequency data: dir function input specified, “plot” folder created directory location png plot saved. also function create raw unexpanded composition data works either length age data. function returns list sexed unsexed marginal age composition data formatted Stock Synthesis. input sample size set equal number samples data frame.
code: age_comps <- get_expanded_comps(     bio_data = bio,     catch_data = catch,     comp_bins = 1:40,     strata = strata,     comp_column_name = "age",     output = "full_expansion_ss3_format",     two_sex_comps = TRUE,     input_n_method = "stewart_hamel") plot_comps(   data = age_comps) raw_age_comps <- get_raw_comps(     data = bio,     comp_bins = 1:40,     comp_column_name = "age",     two_sex_comps = TRUE)

title: Northwest Fisheries Science Center Survey
text: nwfscSurvey provides code analysis Northwest Fisheries Science Center (NWFSC) West Coast Groundfish Bottom Trawl, NWFSC slope, Alaska Fisheries Science Center (AFSC) slope, AFSC Triennial surveys. Code within package allows pulling data NWFSC data warehouse, calculating design-based indices abundance, visualization data, processing length- age-composition data use West Coast groundfish stock assessment. code developed use scientists NWFSC intended work specific data products access using methods specific needs group.

Default "Enter Month". fleet single integer value. user input fleet number assign fleet column based expected format Stock Synthesis. Default "Enter Fleet". verbose logical specifies want print messages warnings console. default TRUE.

text: x data frame nested list depending sexRatioStage dictate function called inside code expands data SurveyLFs.fn() SurveyAFs.fn(). sexRatioStage integer specifying stage expansion sex ratio applied. default value values 1L`` 2L` appropriate. sexRatioUnsexed numerical value within [0.0, 1.0] used sex ratio measured individuals less maxSizeUnsexed. NA_real_, sex ratio stage-1 expansion conducted. maxSizeUnsexed numerical value specifying right side following bin [0, maxSizeUnsexed], fish measured bin assigned sex based sexRatioUnsexed. Fish measurement larger value assigned sex based calculated sex ratio data. bins vector measurement bins used bin measurement interest. Passing bins argument ensures appropriate "like" fish found, .e., bin missing data fish measured fell bin code aware bin missing. TODO: argument avoided bins factors levels documented. verbose logical specifies want print messages warnings console. default TRUE.

title: Assign sex to unsexed fish based on fish with similar traits — SexRatio.fn
text: Assign sex fish sampled sexed based proportion like fish female sexed fish. assigning unsexed fish males females, new sample sizes sex calculated expansion factors augmented. definition classifies "like fish" depends stage expansion, see Details section. sex ratio calculated number females divided sum number females males. , value reported actually proportion females. SexRatio.fn() different behavior depending expansion performed, controlled using sexRatioStage argument. expansion factors returned data frame unaltered unsexed fish. TODO: Decide previous method intended expansion factors changed unsexed fish zero? Also, stage-2 expansion alter number unsexed fish stage-1 . TODO: Think function alters expansion sample sizes just report sex ratio stage used expansion functions . TODO: Change message stage-2 expansion better reflect code TODO: align stage-1 stage-2 expansion details written similar fashion. Stage-1 expansion: Sex ratio observations within tow/measurement bin combination applied unsexed fish within tow/measurement bin; Sex ratio observations within measurement bin across years applied unsexed fish within measurement bin sex ratio information available tow level; Sex ratio nearby measurement bins across years applied unsexed fish within measurement bin zero sexed fish. , nearby bins classified one measurement unit smaller larger current bin. Stage-2 expansion: Sex ratio sexed fish within measurement bin calculated every strata/year combination; Missing sex ratios measurement bin filled based sex ratio measured fish within bin across years strata; Still missing sex ratios measurement bin based sex ratio sexed fish near (.e., plus minus one) measurement bins away across years strata.

title: Check and create survey string — check_survey
text: survey character entry one following options specifies survey pull data . input options : Triennial, AFSC.Slope, NWFSC.Combo, NWFSC.Slope, NWFSC.Shelf, NWFSC.Hypoxia, NWFSC.Santa.Barb.Basin, NWFSC.Shelf.Rockfish (yet working), NWFSC.Hook.Line (yet working), NWFSC.Video, Triennial.Canada National Marine Fishery Service Alaska Fisheries Science Center (AFSC) Triennial survey conducted 1977 - 2004 occurring every 3rd year. initial year, 1977, survey traditionally used calculating indices abundance. Triennial survey sampled areas within Canadian EEZ West Coast Vancouver Island 1980 - 2001 data associated different survey name "Triennial.Canada". AFSC Slope Survey (AFSC.Slope) along west coast U.S. began 1984 occurred annually 1988-2001, exception 1994 1998, surveys conducted. Prior 1997, limited portion coast covered year. U.S. West Coast groundfish stock assessments use four years consistent complete survey coverage (1997, 1999-2001). Northwest Fisheries Science Center (NWFSC) Slope survey (NWFSC.Slope) conducted 1998 - 2001. NWFSC West Coast Groundfish Bottom Trawl survey (NWFSC.Combo) conducted annualy starting 2003 (excluding 2020) samples U.S. west coast shelf slope 55 - 1,280 meters. Data can pulled one survey time, though working allowing vector survey names. Currently, NWFSC.Shelf.Rockfish NWFSC.Hook.Line supported.

text: vector F, M, U values length x vector 0L 3L codify_sex() codify_sex_SS3(), respectively.

title: Code sexes into standardized strings — codify_sex
text: Pattern matching used via grepl() facilitate matching standard potentially erroneous matches. example, code can accommodate number white space characters text string via "^\\s*. Additionally, first letter character string importance code strictly looking versions female, male, unsexed, ignoring case. NA values coded U unsexed. manual produced Washington Department Fish Wildlife, https://wdfw.wa.gov/sites/default/files/publications/01754/wdfw01754.pdf, provides following information regarding various sampling programs codify sex. Alaska Fisheries Science Center Slope Survey stored sexes uses integers, .e., male (1), female (2), unsexed (3). Washington followed format Alaska Fisheries Science Center Slope Survey. Oregon California also use 1 males 2 females; 9 used unknown sex.

title: Code sexes into standardized strings — codify_sex
text: message printed screen values map F, M, U. example, happy entry x, summary  number times happy seen x printed screen via message happy coded U returned value still viable user made aware something potentially wrong x. See examples.

title: Code sexes into standardized strings — codify_sex
text: Kelli F. Johnson

title: Code sexes into standardized strings — codify_sex
code: # All values are successfully coded codify_sex(c("U", "F", "M", 1, 2)) #> [1] "U" "F" "M" "M" "F" # Some values are not initially successfully coded and # warning messages are printed to the screen prior to # changing the uncoded values to "U" codify_sex(c("U", "F", "M", "both", 1, 2, NA)) #> The following unmatched values were found n times in `codify_sex()`: #> 'both' (n = 1) #> 'NA' (n = 1) #> [1] "U" "F" "M" "U" "M" "F" "U" codify_sex(c("both", rep(5, 10), "both", 1, 2, NA)) #> The following unmatched values were found n times in `codify_sex()`: #> '5' (n = 10) #> 'both' (n = 2) #> 'NA' (n = 1) #>  [1] "U" "U" "U" "U" "U" "U" "U" "U" "U" "U" "U" "U" "M" "F" "U"  # Change codified sex from letters to integers for Stock Synthesis codify_sex_SS3(c("M", "U", "K")) #> The following unmatched values were found n times in `codify_sex()`: #> 'K' (n = 1) #> [1] 3 0 0

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ bio_dat <- data.frame(   Age = rep(0:30, each = 20),   Length_cm = rnorm(n = 31 * 20, mean = 50, sd = 5) ) pars_in <- lapply(FUN = log, X = list(   "K" = 0.13,   "Linf" = 55,   "L0" = 5,   "CV0" = 0.1,   "CV1" = 0.1 )) solve <- optim(   fn = estgrowth.vb, par = unlist(pars_in), hessian = FALSE,   Ages = bio_dat[, "Age"],   Lengths = bio_dat[, "Length_cm"] ) predictions <- estgrowth.vb(   Par = solve$par, ReturnType = "Pred",   sdFactor = 1,   Ages = bio_dat[, "Age"],   Lengths = bio_dat[, "Length_cm"] ) plot(bio_dat$Age, predictions[, "Lhat_pred"],   xlab = "Age (years)", ylab = "Predicted length (cm)" ) exp(solve$par) } # }

text: bio_data data frame length-composition data returned pull_bio(). catch_data data frame catch data returned pull_catch(). comp_bins Vector intergers bin length age data create expanded composition data.Values minimum maximum values vector grouped first size plus group size, respectively. example, creating length compositions uses vector bin seq(10, 50, 2) create 2 cm bins fish length [0, 11.99) included 10 cm bin, fish length [12, 13.99) included 12 cm bin, fish [50- Inf) included 50 cm plus bin. strata data frame defines strata provides calculated areas strata returned createStrataDF.fn(). dir Directory output saved. directory file saved. dir = NULL output saved. comp_column_name name column create composition data must string. column can used determine whether format composition data length age compositions looking either age (e.g., age_years, Age, age, best_age) length (e.g., length, length_cm, Length, Length_cm) comp_column_name. comp_column_name case sensitive.default length_cm. output Switch specify return composition data options c("full_expansion_ss3_format", "tow_expansion_only", "full_expansion_unformatted"). default output = "full_expansion_ss3_format" list returned formatted composition data SS3. tow_expansion_only retuns dataframe composition data expanded tow level (first-stage) full_expansion_unformatted returns dataframe compositon data expanded tow strata level formatted SS3. two_sex_comps Default TRUE. TRUE composition data formatted Stock Synthesis two-sex model FALSE composition data formatted single-sex model. input_n_method Determines default input sample size add composition data SS3. three options: c("stewart_hamel", "tows", "total_samples") default "stewart_hamel". month Month samples collected based expected format Stock Synthesis determine length/age estimate compare . Default "Enter Month". fleet fleet number assign composition data based expected format Stock Synthesis. Default "Enter Fleet". partition Partition assign composition data based expected format Stock Synthesis. Partition 0 indicates composition data include composition data, 1 discarded composition data, 2 retained fish . Default 0. ageerr Number ageing error vector apply age data based Stock Synthesis. Default "Enter Numeric". Lbin_lo Lower age bin age composition data based expected format Stock Synthesis. Default value -1 translates lowest age bin. Lbin_hi Upper age bin age composition data based expected format Stock Synthesis. Default value -1 translates highest age_low Deprecated nwfscSurvey 2.2. Use Lbin_lo instead. age_high Deprecated nwfscSurvey 2.2. Use Lbin_hi instead. age_error Deprecated nwfscSurvey 2.2. Positive values pertain rounding right side decimal place negative values pertain rounding left side decimal place, .e., tens hundreds -1 -2. default round nearest integer using digits = 0. bar_width string "n" "equal", former leads bar widths based number observations contained group latter leads equally-sized bars bars data. groups without data, width placeholder x axis smaller width bars groups data regardless option choose. default bars variable widths, .e., "n". ... Additional arguments users want pass ggplot2::cut_width(). data[[column_bin]] factor, least width needs passed create bins. , argument accepted ggplot2::cut_width() can passed, boundary = 0 common calculation bins start zero rather minimum value present, preventing bins like (35.4, 36.4] really want (35, 36].

code: # Add presence/absence factor to data temp <- catch_nwfsc_combo %>%   dplyr::mutate(new = factor(     cpue_kg_km2 <= 0,     levels = c(FALSE, TRUE),     labels = c("Present", "Absent")   ))  # Plot depth bins (50 m) by presence/absence with default colors plot_proportion(   data = temp,   column_factor = new,   column_bin = Depth_m,   width = 50,   boundary = 0 )  # Plot latitude bins (1 decimal degree) by presence/absence with custom # colors plot_proportion(   data = temp,   column_factor = new,   column_bin = Latitude_dd,   width = 1,   boundary = 0 ) +   ggplot2::scale_fill_manual(values = c(     "darkorchid3",     grDevices::gray(0.7)   )) #> Scale for fill is already present. #> Adding another scale for fill, which will replace the existing scale.  # Plot depth bins (25 m) by sex (F, M, U) plot_proportion(   data = bio_nwfsc_combo %>%     dplyr::mutate(Sex = codify_sex(Sex)),   column_factor = Sex,   column_bin = Depth_m,   width = 25,   boundary = 0 ) #> The following unmatched values were found n times in `codify_sex()`: #> 'NA' (n = 1)  # Change to equal sized bars plot_proportion(   data = bio_nwfsc_combo %>%     dplyr::mutate(Sex = codify_sex(Sex)),   column_factor = Sex,   column_bin = Depth_m,   width = 25,   boundary = 0,   bar_width = "equal" ) #> The following unmatched values were found n times in `codify_sex()`: #> 'NA' (n = 1)

title: Pull biological data (age, length, weight) from the NWFSC data warehouse — pull_bio
code: pull_bio(   survey,   common_name = NULL,   sci_name = NULL,   years = c(1970, 2050),   dir = NULL,   convert = TRUE,   verbose = TRUE,   standard_filtering = TRUE )

title: Pull biological data (age, length, weight) from the NWFSC data warehouse — pull_bio
text: survey character entry one following options specifies survey pull data . input options : Triennial, AFSC.Slope, NWFSC.Combo, NWFSC.Slope, NWFSC.Shelf, NWFSC.Hypoxia, NWFSC.Santa.Barb.Basin, NWFSC.Shelf.Rockfish (yet working), NWFSC.Hook.Line (yet working), NWFSC.Video, Triennial.Canada National Marine Fishery Service Alaska Fisheries Science Center (AFSC) Triennial survey conducted 1977 - 2004 occurring every 3rd year. initial year, 1977, survey traditionally used calculating indices abundance. Triennial survey sampled areas within Canadian EEZ West Coast Vancouver Island 1980 - 2001 data associated different survey name "Triennial.Canada". AFSC Slope Survey (AFSC.Slope) along west coast U.S. began 1984 occurred annually 1988-2001, exception 1994 1998, surveys conducted. Prior 1997, limited portion coast covered year. U.S. West Coast groundfish stock assessments use four years consistent complete survey coverage (1997, 1999-2001). Northwest Fisheries Science Center (NWFSC) Slope survey (NWFSC.Slope) conducted 1998 - 2001. NWFSC West Coast Groundfish Bottom Trawl survey (NWFSC.Combo) conducted annualy starting 2003 (excluding 2020) samples U.S. west coast shelf slope 55 - 1,280 meters. Data can pulled one survey time, though working allowing vector survey names. Currently, NWFSC.Shelf.Rockfish NWFSC.Hook.Line supported. common_name character entry desired common name species want pull data data warehouse. Use vector names want information one species desired species included database using one name, e.g., vermilion rockfish (see example ). Use sci_name argument know latin name. sci_name character entry desired scientific name species want pull data data warehouse. Use vector names want information one species desired species included database using one name, e.g., vermilion rockfish (see example ). Use common_name argument know common name. years integer vector length two range years pull data (e.g., c(2003, 2024)). Vector can contain -Inf Inf. dir Directory output saved. directory file saved. dir = NULL output saved. convert TRUE/FALSE convert column names first letter uppercase aligns expected names data processing functions. verbose logical specifies want print messages warnings console. default TRUE. standard_filtering logical TRUE/FALSE specifies whether data filtered using standard filtering removes tows bad performance (water haul poor net performance), stations removed survey sampling protocol.

title: Pull biological data (age, length, weight) from the NWFSC data warehouse — pull_bio
text: Chantel Wetzel

title: Pull biological data (age, length, weight) from the NWFSC data warehouse — pull_bio
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # SurveyName is only arg that has to be specified bio_dat <- PullBio.fn(SurveyName = "NWFSC.Combo")  # Example with specified common name bio_dat <- PullBio.fn(   Name = "vermilion rockfish",   SurveyName = "NWFSC.Combo" )  # Example with specified scientific name bio_dat <- PullBio.fn(   SciName = "Eopsetta jordani",   SurveyName = "NWFSC.Combo" )  # Example with multiple names bio_dat <- PullBio.fn(   SciName = c("Sebastes aurora", "Eopsetta jordani"),   SurveyName = "NWFSC.Combo" ) } # }

what: Pull biological sample information from the NWFSC data warehouse for biological collections taken at sea. Generally these are samples that require lab processing. Generally, these types of biological sample are maturity, stomach, fin clips, and tissue samples. This function returns collection information for these samples include the sample numbers which allows the lab analysis to be linked back to the sampled fish. The website is: https://www.webapps.nwfsc.noaa.gov/data. — pull_biological_samples
